overview: Jesus Christ, Son of God (Matthew 16:16), Messiah who taught through parables revealing the Father's kingdom—crucified and resurrected for salvation (1 Corinthians 15:3-4). Ministry ~30-33 AD.
path: Born Bethlehem (Matthew 2:1-12, Luke 2:1-20 ~4-6 BC), Nazareth childhood (Luke 2:39-52). Baptized Jordan (Matthew 3), wilderness temptation (Matthew 4). Galilee ministry (teaching/healing), Jerusalem crucifixion (Mark 15), resurrection (Matthew 28).
historical: Josephus (Antiquities 18.3.3 mentions execution under Pilate), Tacitus (Annals 15.44 Christ executed by Pilate), Pilate inscription (Caesarea 1961 find). 1st century ossuaries (Caiaphas high priest), crucifixion evidence (heel bone nail, Jerusalem). Gospels as eyewitness accounts (Luke 1:1-4).
teachings_parables: Parables: 30+ in Gospels, earthly stories with heavenly meaning (Matthew 13:3-9 Sower—kingdom reception; Luke 15:11-32 Prodigal Son—Father's mercy deep/wide; Luke 10:25-37 Good Samaritan—love neighbor as self). Teachings: Sermon on Mount (Matthew 5-7—beatitudes, prayer), Great Commandment (Mark 12:30-31—love God/neighbor). Deep/wide like Father: Reveal mysteries to humble (Matthew 11:25), conceal from proud (Matthew 13:11-15).
chronology: Birth ~4-6 BC (Herod death 4 BC), ministry start ~30 AD (Luke 3:23 age 30), crucifixion 33 AD (Pilate 26-36 AD, temple 46 years John 2:20 from 20 BC).
